revision.text:
'''Paul Nardizzi''' is an [[United States|American]] stand-up [[comedian]] based in the [[Boston, Massachusetts]] area. Nardizzi is the winner of the 2001 Boston Comedy Festival, and [[HBO]]'s U.S. Comedy and Arts Festival in 1997. He has appeared on the television programs ''Evening at [[the Improv]]'' and ''[[Late Night with Conan O'Brien]]''.<ref> {{ cite news |title=Nationally-recognized comedian in Friday fundraiser to help special needs kids learn to ride bikes |date=2010-06-25 |first=Megan |last=McKee |newspaper=Boston.com |url=http://www.boston.com/yourtown/news/framingham/2010/06/nationally-recognized_comedian.html |accessdate=2010-07-19 }}</ref><ref> {{ cite news |url=http://www.metrowestdailynews.com/archive/x1641095259/Your-NextDoor-neighbor-is-a-real-laugh-riot |date=2009-06-27 |title=Your ‘NextDoor’ neighbor is a real laugh riot |first=Brad |last=Petrishen |newspaper=MetroWest Daily News }}</ref> Nardizzi has authored the books ''602 Reasons To Be Pissed Off'' and ''The Sarcastic Sports Trivia Book (Volumes 1 and 2)''. He is also the co-author (along with Dave Barend) of the books ''Things That Might Annoy a Yankee Fan'' and ''Things That Might Annoy a Jets Fan''.
==Personal life== Paul is married with 4 children and currently lives in [[Framingham, Massachusetts]].
==Discography== * Sucking A Cow's Udder During A Solar Eclipse (2007) * Turducken (2009)
==References== <references/>
==External links== * [http://www.paulnardizzi.com Official site]
